) Purpose: This IRM provides technical information and guidance for a of campus collection processing procedures on cases originating with Field and Collection, not otherwise addressed in more specialized IRMs. (

) Objective: The objective of General Case Processing (GCP) is to provide technical support to Field Collection (FC) and process requests from officers for IDRS input, including: account adjustments, transfers of credit payment tracers, together with processing under the authority of IRC and the monitoring of Mandatory Currently Not Collectible (CNC) follow-up accounts. (

) Audience: These procedures are intended for Centralized Case (CCP) campus collection tax examining technicians; however, other in Small Business/ Self-Employed (SB/SE) and employees in other may also refer to these procedures. (
) Policy Owner: These Polices are owned by the Director of Collection SBSE. (
) Program Owner: SB/SE Collection Policy is the program owner of this (
) Primary Stakeholders: • Field collection employees • Campus collection employees (
) Program Goals: This guidance is provided to describe a variety of neous campus collection procedures. By following the procedures in this users will be able to appropriately address these issues. (

(a) Preparation of return by Secretary If any person shall fail to a return required by this title or by regulations prescribed thereunder, but consent to disclose all information necessary for the preparation thereof, and in that case, the Secretary may prepare such return, which, being by such person, may be received by the Secretary as the return of such person. (b) Execution of return by Secretary (

) Authority of Secretary to execute return If any person fails to make any return required by any revenue law or regulation made thereunder at the time prescribed therefor, makes, willfully or otherwise, a false or fraudulent return, the Secretary make such return from his own knowledge and from such information as he can obtain through testimony or otherwise. (12-18-2013) Processing Form 900, Tax Collection Waiver

A Form 900 Waiver is a Tax Collection Waiver. It is a legal document executed by a taxpayer, which allows the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to extend the amount of time allowed to collect a tax liability. The maximum time allowed to collect taxes is identiﬁed as the Collection Statute Expiration Date (CSED).
